security: Revealing that Wilcott was instructed to contact the Station for guidance if he sought employment with ODYOKE could expose methods and contacts used to maintain connections with former employees, which could damage ongoing operations.
summary: This dispatch concerns the resignation of James B. Wilcott Jr. from JMWAVE, effective April 15, 1966, and outlines instructions given to him regarding future employment with ODYOKE, along with his employment history.
summary_one_paragraph: A dispatch from the Chief of Station, JMWAVE, to Chief, WH, and INFO, Chief, KUVEST, details the resignation of James B. Wilcott Jr. from his position at JMWAVE under JMOCEAN cover, effective April 15, 1966; it notes his intention to seek employment in private industry. The message includes Wilcott's employment history with KUBARK, spanning from March 1957 to April 1966, and mentions that Wilcott was instructed to contact the Station for guidance should he seek future employment with ODYOKE. A resume written by of JMWAVE is attached under separate cover, which has been concurred in by Chief/Finance and Chief/Cover.
title: DYVOUR/ADMIN/PERSONNEL James B. Wilcott Jr. Debriefing of - Resignation in field
